House of Staunton happily charged me for FedEx shipping but then sent the package via...  USPS.   The package finally arrived after 3 weeks.  After numerous emails and voice messages, the company remains completely unresponsive, and I'm out the extra shipping fees.  This company is awful.

name: Kyle Crider
text: I am sharing this in hopes that those who feel as I do won't waste a trip. I had been planning to visit ROE for quite a while (I do not live in Calera) and was looking forward to visiting both their bar and game store. According to Google Maps, ROE identifies itself as Black-owned, veteran-led, and women-led; three things I would normally go out of my way to support. However, the following sign greeted me upon arrival, prominently featured in ROE's store-front window: "Guns are welcome on premises. Please keep all weapons holstered unless need arises. In such cases, judicious marksmanship is appreciated." So despite making a special trip to Calera specifically to visit ROE, I turned around and never plan to visit so long as this ridiculous and dangerous policy remains in place. As a university professor, I believe in evidence-based reasoning, and data shows that the "good guy with a gun myth" is just that -- a myth. I prefer to keep my tavern interactions with folks armed with deadly weapons to the realm of fantasy, where they belong; NOT my not-so-local hobby shop.

resp.text: As the owner, I would like to say I am sorry that you felt that way about our store without speaking with us about it.  My husband is a combat arms vet and I am military raised, and so we have a slightly different humor.  I agree that our store is not for everyone, just like not every shop is for us.  That being said, spending any time in our store with our regulars would show that while we allow carry (and only a small amount actually carry), misbehavior with such items is NOT TOLERATED.  We have found that those that stay with us, stay because they feel welcomed and accepted for who they are without judgement; and we have ALL types here.  No one here gets away with bullying or criticizing others for their various believes as long as said believes bring no harm to self or others.  We consciously monitor the behavior and body language of everyone that visits as should be done no matter the type of shop.  Once again, I am sorry you felt your trip a waste of time, and hope that you do find a shop where you feel comfortable and happy, because end the end, that is what is important.

name: DrayPullz
text: This place is way too expensive. Try going to any other card shop and they will actually sell you things at a proper price. A slight markup is fine, but this shop is insanely priced on everything. I promise anything you find in that shop you can find on eBay for a minimum of $10-$20 cheaper. Just spend the money you would waste here driving to big box stores  and hunting for product yourself. You are better off.

resp.text: Most of our prices on Magic the Gathering and Yu-Gi-Oh are actually cheaper than Walmart and Target. We have sealed Pokemon product up to 25 years old which is MUCH more than it's retail price. With the huge demand for Pokemon, pricing is increasing daily. Also, while a $200 card in the store might be $180-$190 on eBay, you have to determine whether the $10-$20 difference is worth waiting a week or taking a chance of getting a counterfeit. You have to also remember that eBay is an auction site where you are buying from people selling out of their basement with no overhead. I think you'll find if you look at online card vendors such as Amazon and Tcgplayer, you'll find that even our $7,500 Pokemon booster boxes are priced at the same point as most other dealers. There's only one Pokemon item in the store I know we're high on. Hidden fates elite trainer boxes. I have them priced to make a $3 profit but we are much higher than others due to the recent reprints.

name: Alex E
text: Great store with lots of products. I’m new getting into Pokémon again after almost 20 years and the folks here pointed me in the right direction. Fair prices and a clean store.

name: Corey
text: The prices are marked up and trade in offers are always incredibly low which is unfortunate given the amazing inventory the store offers! However, The customer service is pretty amazing and always very nice and sparks conversation! My literal only complaint is the prices and the incredibly low trade in offers.

resp.text: Your last trade in attempt I recall there was a major discrepancy between what your app said tcgmid was and what it was on their website on a couple of cards. I've also explained to you directly that our pricing is a lower percentage for Pokemon than for Magic since the turnover is much lower than Magic. I realize you play both games and you're welcome to trade in Magic or Pokemon for store credit for anything, not just trading Pokemon for Pokemon. Our singles inventory should be right at Tcgplayer mid prices other than the cards under $1. Our base price for mtg rares and Mythics is $1 and commons is .25. Our Pokemon base price is .25 no matter rarity.  Our sealed products are generally based on Tcgplayer pricing as well. Our main card game is Magic the Gathering and we generally have approximately 100,000 mtg cards traded in per month. We continue to allow trade ins even though we are paying storage fees on somewhere between 2.5 and 3 million cards in the to be processed areas right now. I'm sorry you're disappointed in the service or offers you have received. We always give the customer the pricing and the choice to keep or sell their items. I know that this is not the case exactly with you, but you would be amazed if you knew how many people think if a card is $200 online that they can bring it and sell it to me for $200 cash. I work very hard to offer a fair trade in policy and all individual trade in pricing is based on the percentage given for the particular game and the quality of the card alone. Bulk collections have their own pricing schedules and I ask the players to sort out the expensive cards from the bulk to make sure they get the most money for their trade ins.

name: cwalt Derz
text: Contributing to the problem of scalpers. Pokémon cards sold here yes, but at 4x market value. No daily collector should have to pay that

resp.text: We update our prices twice per week and pricing is based on current market pricing and is due to supply and demand. We generally check both Amazon and Tcgplayer. Right now most Pokemon is selling for more than normal. We are having to pay more than retail for most products just to keep it in stock so people can have a place to purchase it. Our first run of Pokemon that comes direct is priced less than you can get the items direct from Pokemon for. The wholesale companies are charging more as well. We also limit quantities on most Pokemon items so everyone gets a chance to purchase. We keep Pokemon in stock that hasn't been in most retail stores for ten years. Out of print collectibles almost always sell for more than retail. We always have multiple Pokemon items at regular retail price. I also make sure to point those items out to customers when they come in. This is an issue with the limited printing from Pokemon. That's why it's sold out everywhere locally. We've also been cut on available quantities from the distributors. Out of 200 elite trainer boxes of Shining Fates ordered, we received only two and we sold them for $49.99 each release day. Checking with Walmart.com today 3-17-21, MOST products we have in stock are actually less than buying online from them. Example, Shining Fates ETBs are $130 on Walmart.com, they are $99.99 at our store. Evolutions booster packs are $31.99 each at Walmart.com, while ours are $17.99. Vivid Voltage booster boxes are $299.99, ours are $199.99. Crimson Invasion ETBs are $135.24 at Walmart while ours are $84.95. Champion's Path ETBS are $109.99, ours are $99.99. In looking up over 20 in stock products, the ONLY Pokemon item I  found less at Walmart.com was the Dubwool box which is $34.95 while ours is $34.99. Several products I found we are over 50% less than Walmart.com. Market value (also known as OMV, or "open market valuation") is the price an asset would fetch in the marketplace, or the value that the investment community gives to a particular equity or business. I think you were referring to MSRP (Manufacturer Suggested Retail Price) or LIST price. MSRP will not generally apply for out of print or high demand collectibles in ANY industry. Same thing happened with the VW TDI a few years back when they were selling for $20,000 over MSRP and you had to put in your order three months in advance.

name: Jonathan Self
text: The owner of this place is really nice and very helpful. He has great, honest pricing in his store/online, and maintains a really well-done website listing his in-store stock that is really accurate and up-to-date. In my honest opinion the owner seems to be a very genuine guy who really has a passion for having a quality game store. He has an entire back room area dedicated to having people compete with one another and has prerelease parties all the time. Every time I go there with my son Graham we see tons of kids there having a good time and him interacting with them, which I think is great!

name: Branden Moore
text: Really enjoyable experience traveling to Mythic for Friday night magic. My buddy from Atlanta called ahead to ask about FNM, and the owner remembered the caller ID saying Atlanta, so when we arrived he called us out and welcomed us to the shop. He showed us around, introduced us to all the competitors for that night, and was just beyond friendly in helping us out. The shop is CLEAN. Which is huge for card game shops. He has some rules he posts around that included no profanity or smoking inside which really helps it feel welcoming and family friendly. HIGHLY recommended.

resp.text: Branden, thanks for coming out. Any time you're coming through town we'd be glad to have you back. Nathan

name: John Hand
text: Like most FLGS it caters mostly to Collectible Card game players like magic the gathering.  The owner does support board gamers and RPG players, but clearly is supported most by the card players.  His selection of board games has progressively gotten better.  He has a medium collection of games you can play for free.  He also supports some video gaming.   His play space is medium sized and usually active.  It can get loud, but you're sure to meet like minded friends.  Snacks can be purchased and there is a bathroom.  Prices are equal to or higher than other FLGSs.  I currently go there for board gaming Wednesdays from 630  until complete.

resp.text: Thanks John. I think you've noticed lately we've been carrying many more board games. I also think if you'd come in for our Black Friday sale you'd know we're also catering more towards board gamers.  I just did a physical count and we currently have 334 board games / expansions out on the floor (if I didn't miss any) and I put approximately 80 up in storage after the black Friday sale. As far as different titles go, there's a lot to choose from, however I cannot carry every title available. As always, I'm happy to order a title in for you any time.

Came in for a coffee. Server who was going to prepare my drink wiped his nose audibly across his open palm while waiting at the register for my order. Gross. Hard pass.

Update: Check out the Owner's response to this review. Just lovely. I never ordered btw, just excused myself politely and left. Find coffee elsewhere mates! Ye be warned.

resp.text: I prefer to give people an OPPORTUNITY to wash their hands before PREPARING my beverage. Otherwise my daily triggering isn't as fair as the safe place Im constantly demanding.  Those computer screens, along with cash and cards are much grosser that you'd think. Washing hands before TAKING the order just creates the need to wash them again. We wash hands 100% of the time before making ANY beverages. ALWAYS HAVE AND ALWAYS WILL. But yeah, that's gross, and probably embarrassing to the guy attempting to take your order. Downright deplorable. You know that feeling right?  We've all been there and it ALWAYS happens at the worst possible time.  What matters though, really, is the recovery. I hate that you had to leave so abruptly though, as you missed the part where he washed his hands before preparing the drink you ordered. It was good too. I know because I drank it. We love you either way. Even when we don't meet your expectations. We will put your feedback to good use and make it a learning experience.  It is our mission to look to the past and improve the future!!

name: Claudia Bruemmer
text: Great site to order from with excellent customer service. I ordered a chess set to be delivered to my grandson & postman didn't deliver & didn't leave notice so I thought he didn't get it. I called & Robyn helped me troubleshoot the order, said it was at the PO, could be picked up, or she'd try to change delivery to my home instead. My grandson picked it up with no problem; here's what he said: "I just picked it up and it's great. Beautiful board and stores really well with pieces inside. It's perfect! Thank you!!" The set was just as advertised, price great & free shipping, excellent customer service. I recommend this site without reservation.

name: Lucas Anderson
text: The prices and customer service cannot be beat.  As a scholastic coach, Wholesale Chess fulfills most of my needs in a budget-friendly way.  The sets they offer are of great quality, and their responsiveness via email (in case of a missing piece) simply cannot be beat.

name: Keith Halonen
text: So far from Wholesale Chess I've purchased only one Quality vinyl roll-up board and one Quality Starter Combo, which consists of the same vinyl roll-up board plus a standard "Club Special" plastic chess set with a carrying bag. Both shipments arrived in a timely manner. Both parcels were long enough in one dimension to contain the boards without having to fold them. All merchandise was new and arrived in optimum condition. Prices for these basic items are the best I've found online and undercut retail outlets by a wide margin. These beginner items were purchased for my students. Satisfied and persuaded to shop here when I'm in the market for some pricier items.

name: Marina Goldin
text: At some point our two sets of chess pieces for demo boards diminished to one :-) so I was very happy I can buy just a replacement set instead of the whole board/pieces set. And they arrived very quickly. Thanks!

name: Nicholas Eckermann
text:
Excellent job by these guys! I bought a chess set for my son for Christmas and it arrived in the time they told me. I did have a problem with one of the rooks being broken, but a quick email back and forth and they had the new rook on the way and it arrived as promised.
The set I bought was "Heavy Tournament Chess Set Combo". I don't know much about chess but this set seems pretty nice for the price, and I am thinking about ordering another one for another member of our family.

name: Cody Simonsen
text:
I ordered a chess set, didn't get the one I wanted. (I had ordered the wrong type- my fault) I called customer service, no hold time, immediate person. Excellent service, I was treated fairly and was able to exchange my product for the one I wanted.

Shipping was prompt and ahead of schedule!
Will order again!

name: Kristen Becker, NLP
text: Great company to do business with. their prices are excellent and the shipping and follow up was all outstanding! We are very pleased with our purchase and interactions with this store.

name: Robert Armstrong
text: The club board sets and scorebooks I’ve ordered from Wholesale Chess are great for our high school and middle school players. Ordering was easy, and they let me send a check after my order was placed!

name: Phillip Foster
text: Normally WSC is a great place to get chess supplies. But my most recent order was a failure as I never received my package. Customer Service was lacking in helping me resolve this problem.

resp.text: Hi, Bram. Our office manager has emailed you and we are working to help resolve this issue as quickly as possible. Thanks for your feedback!

name: Erik Czerwin
text: I've been buying my chess equipment solely from Wholesale Chess for around 6 years now...  I will always purchase from them.  Their customer service is unparalleled, the prices are the lowest especially when buying in quantity, and shipment/delivery is always prompt and fast.

name: Margaret T
text: Order chess set but came in just carrying bag.  They put pictures of set but not the item they sale, totally misleading!   Not only paid shipping fee, we have to pay to ship back for return. It’s not acceptable and will never order from them.

name: Donna Jackson
text: In one of the puzzles I purchased the whole bottom left side of the puzzle was gone. All the pieces that were missing were white and the ones missing. Don't think I'll take another chance in ordering from you.

name: steve dee
text: I received my set last week. Now for some fun, thanks for everything!!

name: Alexander Beliasvky
text: excellent product for everyone's wallet,excellent customer services

name: Colin Kilbane
text: Got me everything I needed to get a chess club started on one stop!

name: Edward Carr
text: Couldn't even get into the store due to them only serving one person at a time. I'll be spending my money with other hobby shops.

resp.text:
Edward, we are very sorry we were unable to serve you immediately when you arrived. Unfortunately with the current pandemic we are trying to protect both our customers and employees to the best of our ability and this policy is reflective of that. We know that your time and all of our customers time is valuable (as is your potential business with us) and we would be happy to assist you with preparing an order prior to your arrival we are available to communicate with your through email (Gametimehobbiesopelika@gmail.com), Facebook messenger (https://www.facebook.com/gametimehobbies), or even over the phone (334-737-6960) to go over our offerings and a potential order should you be unable to wait for any customers we may be currently assisting. We appreciate your feedback and hope you consider giving us another chance in the future to earn your business.

Drew

name: Chris
text: This is a great local store that has always taken care of me and helped me find what I need. The staff is always really friendly and helpful. The play area is large and clean, they have a great selection on magic and related accessories, and they have a clean restroom. There’s a lot of care that goes into this store, and it shows. I’ve been to plenty of LGSs that left a lot to be desired in terms of service, product selection, and cleanliness, and I have never felt that way at Game Time. I highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to play some magic or one of the other card games they host events for.

resp.text: Thanks Chris for your review and kind words.We sincerely appreciate your business and enjoy having you as a member of our community!

name: Michael Fain
text: The staff at Game Time Hobbies is beyond helpful and are always putting customers first. I recently purchased a copy of Dominion: Guilds and Cornucopia and have been thoroughly satisfied!!! In the past I have played Pokemon TCG in store (no longer offered) and learned how to play magic, the staff taught me and helped me get started! Hoping that more dominion expansions get stocked because I will definitely be buying them. Easy 5/5, although I would love to see the Pokémon prereleases come back :(

resp.text: Thank you Michael for your review, we sincerely appreciate your business!

name: Tara D.
text: Limited to 1 person at a time due to virus. Owner super nice.

resp.text: Hey Tara, thank you for the kind words. We are definitely sorry about the customer limit currently but want to air on the side of caution to protect all members of our community. When things begin to return to normal we have tables set up for guests to play games we carry and we run events for those products as well. Thank you for your business and review!

name: David Axford
text: Recently got into MTG and was met with such friendly response by everyone at the store. Excellent people run the store and excellent people show up. I will definitely be coming back! Thank you for the warm welcome to the MTG community!

resp.text:
Hey David! We are glad you felt welcome! That means so much to us. It was great playing with you tonight! Thanks for the kind words and welcome to the community!

-Drew

name: Stephen Colburn
text: Great table top gaming site!  Awesome people,  always something going on,  great board game,  d&d, and magic the gathering selection.  If they don't have it they can usually get it for you pretty quickly.

resp.text: Thank you Stephen we sincerely appreciate your review and business!

name: Meme Machine
text: Incredibly friendly people and the staff is really knowledgeable. Fun and clean space to play cards, DnD, board games, etc, and they have a great selection of products, as well as fair prices. I highly reccomend them to be your local game store!

resp.text: Thanks Meme machine we appreciate the review and kind words! We are glad you enjoy our store!

name: Drew Mackay
text: Great store carries the best board games, trading card games, and role playing games. Huge selection of RPG miniatures, dice, and trading card game accessories. Also a very large magic the gathering singles collection with great prices. Events every day they are open and friendly employees. Definitely check this place out if you like gaming.

resp.text: Thanks for your review!

name: Jordan Gilchrist
text: Great place for cards and board games. I love the magic selection and events they have as well as the cardfight vanguard tournaments

resp.text: Thanks Jordan we appreciate your review and business!

name: Mr Loyal
text: Pretty nice employee, selection is fairly limited but its a small shop so im not really complaining. I'd rather spend my money here instead of Walmart or target. They have several tables that could be used for more product but it seems like theres a larger interest in letting the community come together and i respect that 100%

resp.text: Thanks for the review Mr. Loyal we appreciate it. If there is ever a product you are looking for that we don't carry or currently have in stock we would love to try and order it for you as well!

name: Kuhlu
text: The staff are super friendly,  knowledgeable and happy to introduce anybody with limited knowledge to fun board/card games. The atmosphere is great for hanging out, and they have tons of different board games that are free to play (which is great for those of us with little money who want to hang out around town.) Definitely worth checking out this little local gem.

resp.text: Thanks Katelyn we appreciate you review!

name: Mason Monday
text: Great location with very friendly staff and clientele.  I buy most of my cards here because of their generous pricing.  Be sure to learn who Ethan is and how to properly deal with him.

resp.text: Hey Mason thanks for your review we definitely appreciate the kind words! If you play commander and want any suggestions for keeping Competitive with Ethan we would be happy to help, that being said I feel it's always the proper choice when playing a game of commander for everyone to take Ethan out first haha! Again thanks for shopping with and spending time with us we certainly appreciate your business!

name: Ethan Thomas
text:
Fun atmosphere, lots of board games, MtG cards, and D&D accessories. There's also a room in the back you can reserve for D&D sessions and the like.
I recommend stopping by for Friday night Magic.

resp.text: Thanks Ethan we appreciate your review!

name: shannon smith
text: Great shop lots of game and friendly people

resp.text: Thanks Shannon we appreciate your review and your business!

name: Jordan Morris
text: The owner Drew is always so helpful. Whatever you're gaming needs he can help you or direct you to the right place. I love playing D&D here weekly! D&D 5e playtime is Thursdays at 6pm go to the back room and introduce yourself.

resp.text: Thanks Jordan

name: Laura Conklin
text:
Great selection for anyone who plays Magic,  Pokemon,  DnD, Star Wars Legion,  board games,  or other similar games.
They have a big bin of games that are free to sit and play through.
Very friendly,  relaxed family atmosphere.

resp.text: Thanks Laura we sincerely appreciate your review and your business! We love having you as a part of our community.

name: Hank Womble
text: Excellent place to play board and card games. Very clean and well kept with an impressive stock of games and accessories. There is a bathroom in house and from what I can tell, many events throughout the week hosted there. Will go back soon!

resp.text: Thanks Hank we appreciate the kind words.

name: David Klash
text: Small game store.  Primarily Magic the Gathering. Also board games and D&D. No Games Workshop (Warhammer) at all but does have Reaper D&D miniatures and Army Painter paints. Several tables for MtG tournaments and such.

resp.text: Hi David! Thanks for taking the time to review our store! We don't Carry Games workshop but we do have the availability to order their products for customers if you are interested in their line! Also we don't currently stock reaper the many minatures we carry are from the Wizkid D&D line. Hope you had a good experience overall!

name: Skylar Skylar
text: Worst Gamestop Ever, i came in looking for cooking mama and all they had babysitting mama. Never again will I buy my bakugan from here. Bey lade bey lade let it rip!

resp.text: Skylar, We appreciate your rating and although your review is fabricated we appreciate the humor!

name: Sunny Grisham
text: Good place to buy cards and the play games. The staff is very knowledgeable on their items

resp.text: Thanks Sunny we appreciate the kind review!

name: Mirage
text: The owners are really nice. Great local scene for Pokemon TCG and Magic the Gathering. Great selection on board games too!

resp.text: Thank you! we appreciate the kind words and your business!

name: Hart
text: This is a great Local Gaming Store and the staff is awesome and helpful. I love doing business here

resp.text: Thank you Hart for your review and for your business!

name: jason bond
text: I went in on there for black Friday and they had sales so naturally I looked at their 50% sales. They had cards agasint humanity for 49.99 with 50 percent off. This store doubled the price and then used the discount to make it look like a deal. The game normally goes for 25 dollars. This is predatory. Either have a sale or dont.

resp.text:
Hey Jason sorry about that. We typically sell most all board games for MSRP. Unfortunately we are not able to do that for CAH as they are exclusive to Target and Amazon, so they only way for us to carry this game is to order through Amazon and increase the price since they do not work with brick and mortar stores. We are planning on not stocking this item in the future which is why it's on the sale shelf at selling at 50% of the marked price. We literally just get back our initial investment, which isn't predatory although I can certainly understand why it may seem that way. Sorry for the misunderstanding and we hope that you will give us a second chance in the future.

-Drew

name: David Pugh
text: Great selection of board games and a super friendly and knowledge staff!

resp.text: Thanks David we appreciate the kind review! Hope to see you again soon!

resp.text: Thanks Jeri we appreciate your review!

name: MALGUS78 STARKILLER
text: This place is ok if you are into the role playing board games but do not stop by looking for model building kits or diorama accessories because they do not carry them.

resp.text: Hi Malgus, I am sorry you did not find what you were looking for. Unfortunately with the cost of some product lines or accessories we can't carry everything. We specialize in trading card, role playing and board games. I don't think its fair to fault us with a 1 star review because we don't carry other product lines. However if you are looking for Model kits Hobby Town near Panera Bread or Hobby Lobby in Tiger Town may be a places that would carry what you need.

name: Phillip Cross
text: Very helpful staff

resp.text: Thanks!I am glad we were able to help you out!

name: Jay Robinson
text: It’s closed. @google, please remove this listing or update the store hours to permanently closed.

name: Grillenheimer
text: It's closed.  Drove by everything is gone.  Guess Paul closed his secondary shop.

name: Russell Noyes
text: The sister location of Legion Comics (formally Empire Comics). I've been a customer for over 20 years and always will be. The owner is a super nice guy.

name: Chris Stewart
text: Good space for gaming. I go there strictly for comics but I won't be back. Prices based off Ebay which is ridiculous, especially for week one comics. $35 Friday for a book that was released two days prior on Wednesday. Staff hounds you constantly and follows you around like you're trying to steal something. Whole experience very awkward. Avoid, better shop less than 3 miles from this one.

name: Xyan Aguilar
text:
Owner has product that had accumulated dust because of how low demand they are (e.g. out of print, no longer relevant games). The business model of this place does not cater to customers at all. Their philosophy is to hold items on the slim chance that they appreciate in value to sell online, and the items that decrease in value they hope to sell at MSRP for those who don't realize they could get it for cheaper elsewhere.

Everything in store is MSRP, no discounts.That would make sense if they were selling fresh, just released product, but the store is filled with nothing but old product that can be found for half the price elsewhere. They used to provide a discount when you paid entirely in cash but that seems to have disappeared.

I have no problem paying more to support a store that allows us table space and a nice atmosphere to play, but this store has neither. All table space is catered specifically for miniature wargames (which are better for standing at rather than sitting down) and the one lone table in the back is always filled with a MtG game, leaving no room for anything else.

The employees have little to no knowledge of anything outside of MtG and consistently complain (under their breath and behind our backs) about the lack of purchases customers make if they just come in to play a game or two, which makes sense considering their greedy practice. Even after bringing in new customers that would've never thought to bring in, as well as setting up events ourselves that the store didn't bother helping with, we as customers are still considered a burden. Their demo shelf is also filled with games they don't carry or are out-of-print, so if you try a game out that you like, you won't even be able to purchase it, nor a copy of it, in the store.

Tournaments and events are horribly disorganized. I payed and 'participated' in a Keyforge league and paid to play a couple of games per week, but as it got near the end it turns out that missing a match never mattered and the final tournament with a promised prize support (hence the initial payment) never showed up. The new matchups were ALWAYS late and overall it was a lackluster experience that I could've just played with friends for a better time.

That's not to say it's been all bad, one employee named Josh was always super helpful and friendly, making space for us and always letting us borrow any of his supplies (like brushes and paints) to help out with beginning miniatures, but he left a while back and haven't seen him since. He was the last saving grace that the store was hanging on and now it's not worth any of my time nor money to bother going.

name: Renaldo “Inventor of the Slap” Flowers
text: Awesome spot to get all your comic, collectible, table top needs

They have a decent selection of miniatures, comics, mangas, RPG's, and collectibles and it's constantly growing. And if they don't have what you're looking for in stock, they'll be sure to order it.

text: Great place, we went there to play games, had a wonderful time!

name: Grillenheimer
text: Small yet they have a ton of cards, games and accessories.  Super nice owner.  They even sell Transformers deck boxes!  But no boosters.  They even have the large top loaders for characters like Omega Supreme, Fort Max, Metroplex and Trypticon for only $1.  Rooms upstairs and multiple tables downstairs for game play.  Parking can be an issue but Leeds doesn't have that much traffic.

name: Joshua French
text: Bud's Place Games is the place for table top games in Leeds. They have events, free private rooms, and a great selection of games of all types to buy. If they don't have it they are more than willing to try and order it for you and it is almost always at least comparable to Amazon, sometimes it is even cheaper.

name: SadMoonBeam
text: I order cards online from them and pick up in store, super easy and convenient. Saves me time and waiting for cards from eBay. I highly recommend more people use this, so more cards can be put in the online store. Buds place is also a great place to play table top rpg games, with plenty of room to play.

name: Rick Goudeau
text: A great place for playing games and to get your games and cards. Nice selection of games to choose.  My FLGS with the emphasis on Friendly. Love having my weekly game night there.

name: Stephanie Newman
text: We go to Bud's at least two times a month. Great place to game and the people are great.

name: Chris McCormick
text: Hands down the best place for gaming and your gaming needs. Owner is incredibly friendly and offers the best prices around coupled with the best gaming environment around! Love this place and wouldn’t go anywhere else!

name: Andrew Thomas
text: Good place. These guys are very accommodating to the table top gaming community.

name: Mark

text: Big fan of Bud's place!! This was my 1st visit in 4 plus years.  They've made some awesome improvements!! The store seems more family friendly and they have tons and tons of tabletop games to encourage family time at home!!

name: Lynn Culpepper
text: An awesome place for gaming and socializing with your geeky friends.  It is the BEST place for buying or selling MAGIC singles.  They are fair and honest.  They have air conditioning, bathrooms, snacks and cold drinks, and A LOT of tables for whatever game you want to play!

name: Adora Scruggs
text: Very friendly and helpful staff and good selection of items. There are also nice rooms upstairs to have separate games going at the same time.

name: Justin Moorer
text: I have been coming to this store for the last 2 years. The owner is very helpful and seems upbeat.  I found this place through my best friend and have been coming here ever since.  The staff is wonderful and the game choices are really excellant.  Kudos to the owner and the staff for making this my place to hang out on lunch from work or just to go during the week and weekend.  Friday Night Magic is one of their busiest nights!

name: Michael Streufert
text: The guys here are amazing with my kids and very helpful.  They host assorted tournaments every week.  There are a lot of tables to play on and they have a loaner library of games you can try out.  I have known these guys for a long time and enjoy visiting.  Bud's Place is very prompt to reply to Facebook messeges.  I cannot say enough nice things about this place.

text: Awesome.  Pokeman, Magic the gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh are played frequently.  They buy cards.  Crowded every weekend.

name: greatcornholio

Its by far the best place I have found to get Magic the gathering singles even cheaper than you can find them on eBay. If you're ever in leeds and a gamer you should stop in and see what you've been missing out on.

name: Jesse Sierke
text: I had a great time here playing games with awesome people. The staff were supportive of my needs, and the selection of items for my game (D&D Adventurers League) was pretty good. I'd love to help them set up some display tables for wargaming, but I understand that space is a premium.

name: Roland Garofalo
text: I have not visited their physical location, but I must say their customer service is phenomenal. A few months back I ordered some MTG cards online that came through their store. Unfortunately, the cards never shipped due to a processing error, no big deal. I gave 'em a call, and they immediately put all their effort into fixing the error and sending me the cards. AND they also included some foil promos in the package that were worth way more than the cards I purchased originally. It's great to see a LGS that truly supports their customers. If you are in the area, I highly recommend checking them out.

name: adam ledbetter
text: Great store! Always a good experience when I go here.

name: patrick tatum
text: I’ve been a regular for years. Mark is one of the most kindest and caring store owners I’ve ever met. Matt Johnson the Gen. manager is a professional and keeps a tight ship as well as he works with customers.

name: Aaron
text: Have generally always had good experiences here.

name: M M G
text: Great selection of board games and card games. Drove 30 miles to check the store out, wasn't disappointed at all.

name: Brian Graves
text: Best game store in town.  The owner genuinely cares about his customers and will stay open late just for the players to enjoy sometimes.   Very fair on pricing and the best selection of products around.

name: Ian McPherson
text: Nice small shop. Plenty of space for playing really anything. There are private rooms upstairs for dnd or boardgames.

name: Morgan Pendley
text: Absolutely wonderful shop, one of the best in the Birmingham area. Extremely friendly owner and staff, by far the best service around. Good selection of product, everything from MTG to board games.

name: thomas hames
text: Always a great place to game.

name: Captain England
text: Best place I've ever been to for games. Great for Magic, Pokemon, and Vanguard card games. Nowhere else is as good for Board games, manager is extremely knowledgeable. Has multiple rooms/areas for board gaming, rpgs, or  anything the like.

name: timothy dumas
text: This store is pretty amazing. I've been going weekly for two years and the Owner Mark is exactly what you want for this type of store. He is upbeat, honest, hard working and willing to help you out if he can. their prices for mtg are going to be the lowest in the birmingham area because of his pricing system. he has all the standard cards in binders so you can flip through at your convenience,with a lap top connected to his store sitting right beside them so you can check his stock online just as fast as he can. he has two glass cases with his more expensive cards which are organized like they should be by color, white, blue, black, red, green and artifact followed by lands. and also by format, standard, modern, legacy, commander. If you never have been before it is worth your time if you're close to stop in and say hey and look around. Thanks for the great store Mark!

name: Tanner Buckley
text: This is a really good place with a lot of good cards. They have very good prices and knowledgeable. I wish that they got more attention then what they do!

name: Louis Frohock
text: An excellent shop, one of the best in the state. The friendliest owner and staff, the sweetest service around. Great selection of product, everything from card games to board games.

name: Jacob Lee
text: Matt and Alex are super awesome. The atmosphere is fantastic and they assist however they can. Will be back starting next week!

name: Kevin Cassidy
text: Decent little shop, very friendly service, and great prices and availability. Came in looking for some card sleeves, deck box, storage box, and possibly a few single Yu-Gi-Oh cards. He had all of the above, including a computer for ordering cards on their own website, then receiving them in only 15-20 minutes (their warehouse was right up the street). Place was very lively and busy with players too.

name: Rachel Kendrick
text: It's fun, everyone is very friendly, and it's local.

name: Shawn Temple
text: Best prices I've found in Alabama by far, below TCGplayer Mid price. Great selection, very organized, amazing owner. Parking isn't the best but I've been at worse places. If you're in the area check it out!

name: Vivian Downs
text: Home sweet home!! My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to play Magic after Mad Doctor in Birmingham closed. We had tried another that really just didn't cut it, and then  friend of ours told us we should really come here. Instantly I felt at home. I made friends fast and the owner takes good care of his customers. He helps them with all of their needs and works with them when he needs to to give them the best experience he can. I just recently got into Heroclix, and Bud's has the friendliest heroclix community around!! I love this place, and support it as much as I can!

Nice staff very helpful when we had questions about things and when we asked about gameing made sure we knew where to go to help us find a gameing group and we can resurve tables and if we had more questions to feel free to contact them. All in all i expected this store to be like all the rest but, it really had a comfortable feel and for every introvert out there that's a nerd i would recommend it. (Yes masks are required at the time of the review)

Definitely a fantastic gaming and hobby store, worth a look at if you are in the area or looking for a place to hobby at.
